ygData.subject: Graduate Schools
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I just took the GRE last weekend, with an eye toward applying for graduate school.  I don t have a strong CS background, and I m not really interested

Hi all,

I just took the GRE last weekend, with an eye toward applying for 
graduate school.  I don't have a strong CS background, and I'm not 
really interested in a PhD in computer science anyway.  What I'd like 
is an interdisciplinary PhD program, in which I would spend as much 
time studying evolutionary biology and genetics as I would 
programming, or psychology, or neuroscience.

UCSD looks like they've got a great program.  I'm looking at UT 
Austin, but I think I'd have to pursue a CS degree there.  And I'm 
looking at a couple of other schools.  I know Tyler has suggested the 
HCI program he's in at...is it Iowa State?

But I'm curious to hear anyone else's experiences applying or 
attending graduate schools, and I'd appreciate any advice anyone 
could give.

I also don't mind living abroad.  I've looked a bit at schools in 
Japan and the UK, but still don't know much.  There are a few brits 
on this list...anyone have any advice for an international student 
possibly interested in studying there?

Thanks,
Derek
